item.title: [HIVE-20053] Separate Hive Security from SessionState
item.description:
Right now we have Hive security classes associated with SessionState. When HiveServer2 starts, the service session will initialize it and later each session will need to reinitialize. Since such security configuration is on service level, we should move security info out out SessionState and make it Singleton so we can initialize it once.

And also, since SessionState.setupAuth() - to setup authentication and authorization is not synchronized, we could run into concurrency issue if queries or meta operations are run within same session.
item.summary: Separate Hive Security from SessionState

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-20054] Propagate ExecutionExceptions from the driver thread to the client
item.description:
In AbstractSparkClient we have the following code:

       try {
          driverFuture.get();
        } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
          // Give up.
          LOG.warn("Interrupted before driver thread was finished.", ie);
        } catch (ExecutionException ee) {
          LOG.error("Driver thread failed", ee);
        }

If the driver Future throws an ExecutionException the error is simply logged, and a RuntimeException is thrown with the generic message "Error while waiting for Remote Spark Driver to connect back to HiveServer2."

We should propagate the ExecutionException to the client.
item.summary: Propagate ExecutionExceptions from the driver thread to the client

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-20056] SparkPartitionPruner shouldn't be triggered by Spark tasks
item.description: It looks like SparkDynamicPartitionPruner is being called by every Spark task because it gets created whenever getRecordReader is called on the associated InputFormat.
item.summary: SparkPartitionPruner shouldn't be triggered by Spark tasks

ATTACHMENT ID: 12931667 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Rui Li could you take a look? It seems that we call SparkPartitionPruner whenever we call init in HiveInputFormat, but init is called in both getSplits and getRecordReader, which means we call SparkPartitionPruner for every file that we open inside a HoS task. Calling the pruner means reading the associated file on HDFS. This change ensures that the pruning is just done once.

Thanks Sahil Takiar, nice catch. Patch looks good to me.
Nit:

+    if (work instanceof MapWork) {
+      if (HiveConf.isSparkDPPAny(jobConf)) {

=> if (work instanceof MapWork && HiveConf.isSparkDPPAny(jobConf))

       if (spec == null) {
-        throw new AssertionException("No partition spec found in dynamic pruning");
+        throw new IllegalStateException("No partition spec found in dynamic pruning");
       }

Just use Preconditions?
Thanks for taking a look Rui Li. Addressed your comments.

item.title: [HIVE-20057] For ALTER TABLE t SET TBLPROPERTIES ('EXTERNAL'='TRUE'); `TBL_TYPE` attribute change not reflecting for non-CAPS
item.description:
Hive EXTERNAL table shown as MANAGED after conversion using 

 ALTER TABLE t SET TBLPROPERTIES ('EXTERNAL'='True')

 

The DESCRIBE FORMATTED shows:

Table Type:            MANAGED_TABLE
Table Parameters:
                               EXTERNAL           True

 

This is actually a External table but shown wrongly as 'True' was used in place of 'TRUE' in the ALTER statement.

Issue explained here: 

StakOverflow - Hive Table is MANAGED or EXTERNAL
item.summary: For ALTER TABLE t SET TBLPROPERTIES ('EXTERNAL'='TRUE'); `TBL_TYPE` attribute change not reflecting for non-CAPS

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment:
GitHub user animenon opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/388

HIVE-20057: Fix Hive table conversion DESCRIBE table bug

Fix for #HIVE-20057

Issue: `Table Type` wrongly shown as `MANAGED_TABLE` after converting table from MANAGED to EXTERNAL using ` ALTER TABLE t SET TBLPROPERTIES ('EXTERNAL'='True')`

(this is shown correctly only for `'EXTERNAL'='TRUE`)

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/animenon/hive patch-1

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/388.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #388

commit 1a9674645c3b4e3080f5278f6bea3126b1cebbac
Author: Anirudh <animenon@...>
Date: 2018-07-02T19:53:03Z

HIVE-20057: Fix Hive table conversion DESCRIBE table bug

`equals` to `equalsIgnoreCase`
Fix: https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/388

item.title: [HIVE-20059] Hive streaming should try shade prefix unconditionally on exception
item.description: AbstractRecordWriter tries hive.classloader.shade.prefix on ClassNotFoundException but there are instances where OrcOutputFormat from old hive version gets loaded resulting in ClassCastException. I think we should try shadeprefix when defined and when any exception is thrown.
item.summary: Hive streaming should try shade prefix unconditionally on exception

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Tests are not affected by this change.
There are no tests that affects this change as this code path is not triggered by hive. I will commit this patch.
Committed to branch-3 and master. Thanks for the review!
